intro: Osbeckia cochinchinensis, commonly known as the Vietnamese willow or Chinese willow, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Goodeniaceae. It is a perennial herb characterized by its slender, branching stems and alternate, ovate to lanceolate leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-white in color, arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. Osbeckia cochinchinensis is native to Southeast Asia, including regions such as Vietnam, Cambodia, and Thailand. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories or along stream banks.
